metadata.Title: CVE-2023-1206 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
A hash collision flaw was found in the IPv6 connection lookup table in theLinux kernelâ€™s IPv6 functionality when a user makes a new kind of SYN floodattack. A user located in the local network or with a high bandwidthconnection can increase the CPU usage of the server that accepts IPV6connections up to 95%.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1206` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-34-generic - 6.2.0-34.34
linux-image-6.2.0-34-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-34.34
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-34-generic - 6.2.0-34.34
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-34-generic-64k - 6.2.0-34.34
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1014-kvm - 6.2.0-1014.14
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1013-aws - 6.2.0-1013.13
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1014-azure - 6.2.0-1014.14
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1016-gcp - 6.2.0-1016.18
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1014-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1014.14
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1014-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1014.14
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1013-oracle - 6.2.0-1013.13
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1014-raspi - 6.2.0-1014.16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-34.34').
linux-kvm package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1014.14').
linux-aws package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1013.13').
linux-azure package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1014.14').
linux-gcp package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1016.18').
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needed').
linux-lowlatency package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1014.14').
linux-oracle package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1013.13').
linux-raspi package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1014.16').
